ratings.comment: Yu Chan is probably one of the best math professors here at UW-Madison. He provides excellent and clear class notes on Canvas along with so practice problems that are similar to exam questions. The exams are so very doable and easy if you study his notes. In general, easy A with a little effort. His jokes are also good lol. Thank you Yu Chan!

This man. I don't know where to begin. Not only is he the most passionate professor ever, but he also cares so much about his students. He makes sure that everyone in the class (like all 200 kids) understands what he's teaching, and of course they did! He was so amazing. I think I'm in love with him.

Just a genuinely good person. I was in a bit of a rough spot with my math before going to him, and he really helped me get back the confidence and love for math that I had lost. Easily the best math prof I've had so far at Madison, very clear and simplifies things down to the point that you can actually apply it yourself.

Hes a good professor who establishes clear expectations of his students. If you come to class and do all the homework, you will get a good grade and vice versa. Its not too much work, but you do have to do all the work. 10/10 would recommend.

He was so caring and funny, he made a class I was extremely intimidated by super manageable. His exams are very fair, and the homework was never too tough. One of my favorite teachers I have had, definitely the best math teacher I have ever had. HIGHLY recommend.

Yu-Chan was by far one of my favorite math professors that I've ever had. He is always ready to answer any questions you have and is very open to meeting with students to help them. He made is grading criteria very clear and there were never any curve-balls on the tests.

One of the best professors for math at UW Madison. Lectures are interesting and easy to understand. He is very patient with concepts and does not rush. His methods of explaining important concepts is also brilliant.

Yu chan is the best professor that I've met at UW madison. His notes were amazing and tests were straight forward. He is always ready to answer every single question. Whenever I went to his office hour, he answered all of my questions. I was looking forward to take another math class with him, but sadly he left. I wish him good luck.

This class was unbelievably straight forward. Put the time into really understanding your notes. His note outlines are incredible, I'd highly recommend printing them for lectures. Problems on the exams are pretty much the same with the exception of the numbers. Reading the textbook and doing the recommended problems helps, but is not necessary.

Yu-Chan's lectures were always clear and concise. The difficulty of content (as well as Yu-Chan's humor) picked up rapidly as the semester went on. His testing goals were clearly outlined, and there were no curve balls. He always had funny stories while he erased the board, which made this one of the first math classes I've actually enjoyed.

Great teacher. Actually cares about teaching you content. His english is really good and you can understand him. Goes over a lot of examples in class. Tests and quizzes are just like homework, nothing harder. Very specific about his standards/grading. Lectures not mandatory but go to them; they're really helpful.

The best math instructor I have had at UW so far. Lectures are very clear and the quizzes and tests were fair. Gave lots of online resources to help with learning. Nice and funny guy, would recommend to anyone.
Yu Chan was a great professor who made math easy and interesting to learn. Sad that he won't be at UW next year for other students.

He is a very nice person and teaches very well. He illustrates everything clearly in his lecture, which enables me to understand in time. It is such a pity that he will not teach next year. Hope him everything OK!

Yu-Chan shows that he really cares about his students with his lectures. He spends lots of time working through examples, drawing beautiful pictures, and keeping everyone engaged. Exams are very fair and straightforward. Wonderful professor and a wonderful person.

On the first day of class he said "my goal is to make sure that at the end of the semester you don't hate math more than you already do" and definitely stuck to that. Not much homework, exams are EXACTLY what he says is gonna be on there. Hes a good guy.

Yu-Chan may seem quiet, but throughout the semester, he showed how much he cares about his students and math. Honestly, go to lecture, do the homework and discussion worksheets and you WILL BE FINE. This man doesn't try to trick you with anything. Actually makes math understandable and intuitive. I took 2 years gap between Calc 2 and Calc 3.

Before his class, I never know why Math can be interesting!!!!! I hate math since elementary school, but I can feel he tried really hard to make his class interesting!!! The BESR PROFESSOR I have ever met in UW. You have to take his class!!!!

He's a very good professor. As other people have said, his notes in class are really clean and organized. He also gives clear examples in class as well. He also really cares about his students, making jokes and also really stressing the fact that, "as long as you study, you will do good." Better than YouTube for sure.
AWESOME!
Take his class!! Hes amazing and also undeniably hilarious. Times flies during his class and you feel it that he does want everyone to pass and love math.
Hilarious professor with very clear expectations for his class. Instruction was clear and easy to follow; I felt very well prepared for his exams.
